dialogues.text: I don't see the value.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell me marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... Uh... How how about love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Stability?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many stabile marriages do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone to talk to, spend your life with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surrounded by people to talk to. I doubt that will change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shuttle stops and everyone goes to grab their bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie enter, still having the same conversatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about just not dying alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stops to address this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting when I was twelve, we moved each one of my grandparents into a nursing facility. My parents went the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make no mistake. We all die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan turns, thinks of something, then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those cult members down in San Diego with the white sneakers and little Dixie cups of Kool-Aid. They didn't die alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks steamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just saying - There's options.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of nowhere, Natalie starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is now balling in the middle of the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian left me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan goes to hug Natalie and she simply folds into his ar A mop of tears. Ryan looks around for a place to set her down. Instead, he finds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX - Who gives a questioning look to the young sobbing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Alex this is Natalie. Natalie, this is my... friend, Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should give you both a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie attempts a recovery. It's not graceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's fine. I'm fine. Just stupid emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie gives Alex a firm handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan goes to challenge the idea, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie leads the way. Alex and Ryan exchange quick hello

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEXT READS: "I Think it's time we c other people"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three share a booth. Natalie is sipping a drink. She to have settled a little. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He broke up with you over text message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of like firing people over the internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Natalie and Alex shoot Ryan a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the ex-boyfriend) What a weasely prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what does that make me? Someone who falls for a prick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all fall for them. Pricks are spontaneous, unpredictable, and fun. And then we're surprised when they turn out to be pricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I followed him to Omaha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a job waiting for me in San Fran, when he got an offer from ConAgra. He told me we could start a life together. So I followed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Nebraska.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look in the mirror and I just see compromise... I'm supposed to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't... I thought I'd be engaged by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. None taken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was sixteen, I thought by twenty three, I would be married, maybe have a kid... Corner office by day, entertaining at night. I was supposed to be driving a Grand Cherokee by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life can underwhelm you that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I have my sights on twenty nine, because thirty is just way too... apocalyptic. I mean, where did you think you'd be by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie catches herself, having no idea how old Alex is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a certain point, you stop with the deadlines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can be a little counterproductive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to say anything that's... anti-feminist. I mean, I really appreciate everything your generation did for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (my generation?) It was our pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sometimes it feels like no matter how much success I have, it all won't matter until I find the right guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really thought this guy was the one. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. I don't know. I could have made it work. He just really fit the bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My type. You know, white collar. College grad. Loves dogs. Likes funny movies. Six foot one. Brown hair. Kind eyes. Works in finance but is Outdoorsy, you know, on the weekends. (we think she's done) I always imagined he'd have a single syllable name like Matt or John or... Dave. In a perfect world, he drives a Four Runner and the only thing he loves more than me is his golden lab. Oh... and a nice smile. (back to Alex and Ryan) How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This catches both Alex and Ryan off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I meant Alex...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh, let me think for a sec. (mulls it over) Well, by the time you're thirty four, all the physical requirements are pretty much out the window. I mean you secretly prey he'll be taller than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not an asshole would be nice? Just someone who enjoys my company. Comes from a good family - You don't think about that when you're younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants kids... Likes kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wants kids. Healthy enough to play catch with his future son one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can tell Ryan is taking a serious interest in this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let him earn more than I do. That doesn't make sense now, but believe me, it will one day. Otherwise it's just a recipe for disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully some hair on his head...? But it's not exactly a deal-breaker anymore. Nice smile... Yep, a nice smile just might do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex looks to Ryan. He has a nice smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That was depressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Ryan react - It's not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should just date lesbians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tried it. We're no picnic ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks worse than when the conversation started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind being married to my career, and I don't expect it to hold me in bed as I fall asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want to settle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're young. Right now you see settling as some sort of failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is. By definition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, by the time someone is right for you, it won't feel like settling... And the only person left to judge you will be the twenty four year old girl with a target on your back. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie cracks a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan looks to Alex. They've grown closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, Alex, and Natalie wheel their ROLL-AWAYS towards th elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's the plan for this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex share an uncomfortable silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...? Oh, is it illicit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We were going to hit that party for the tech conference in the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie notices a group of SOFTWARE TYPES mingling with badges around their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you could just attend those...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to crash it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I don't know if... More money than they know These guy put on a quite a what to do with... party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I get it. I'm in! 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, Alex, and Natalie confidently walk up to the CHECK- TABLE and take BADGES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn the corner. Alex reads Natalie's badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer Chu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corporate color balloons. Lots of guys in LOGO POLOS. Tha great hip hop song from 1998 is playing over the PA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Ryan, Alex, and Natalie at a stand up table. They wearing badges. Natalie is pretty tipsy at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... This was a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so pretty. You're exactly what I want to look like in fifteen years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONFERENCE LEADER steps up to an on stage MIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everyone doing out there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People cheer. So do Ryan, Alex, and particularly Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need you to all put your hands together for a very special guest - YOUNG... M... C!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening beats of the 90's jam "Bust-A-Move" blast ove the speakers and sure enough, now-40-year-old rapper, You MC steps out and starts rapping. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone goes crazy and starts dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex make it out to the dance floor. They're awf dancers, but they're having fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think she'll be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie has already found a dancing partner, who can't believe his luck. She's all over him. Ryan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nice two story yacht that was obviously purchased befor the bubble popped. Inside the galley, a group is playing karaoke. NATALIE, wearing BADGES like Mardi Gras beads, i singing "Time After Time".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, near the back, Ryan and Alex sit with their le hanging off the back of the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back home, I don't get to act the way I do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I don't have a "back home".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. You're so cool. "Mr. Empty Back Pack".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan emotionally stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know about the back pack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I googled you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did? 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what us modern girls do when we have a crush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it bother you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that depends. Is the bag empty because you hate people or just the baggage they bring along?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hate people. I'm not exactly a hermit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't want to be tied down? The whole responsibility thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it's even that... I... First time I ever flew, I was sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to answer? You're just going to tell me a story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, continues story) It was January and I had just gotten my driver's license. The lakes were frozen over, so we piled into my car and hit the ice to do donuts. When, out of nowhere, I hit a soft spot and the hood of my car tilted up and I was sinking backwards into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I literally started to drown. Within a few seconds, I black out. Then, I wake up in the sky. I'm in a helicopter, laying on a stretcher. This guy in a uniform is telling me I was minutes away from dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? (relives it for a second) So just as we're hovering over the hospital, I sit up. And from there, I could see the whole western horizon. We'd been flying twenty minutes. Twenty minutes to reach a city I'd thought of as remote, halfway across the state... a foreign capital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents had taught me we lived in the best place on Earth, but now I could see the world was really just one place and comparing didn't make much sense. And I remember thinking - Don't tell me this isn't an age of miracles. Don't tell me we can't be everywhere at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea settles in. Ryan returns to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what originally sparked the back pack. I probably needed to be alone. Recently, I've been thinking that maybe I needed to empty the bag before I knew what to put back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now they kiss. It's notably different from their prev kisses. Now, when they lock lips, we are reminded why peo kiss in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, all of a sudden, the lights go out on the boat. The motor has stopped. Ryan and Alex look back to find the software dude stepping out of the galley, drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... I think we're out of gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex look out to shore... about 500 yards away. whatever reason, they just start cracking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex are huddled under a blanket in the corner o the rubber boat as it putters its way to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold, soaked, and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and David are there too... still kissing. 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gets out of the boat in the cold knee deep water splashes up to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex followed by Natalie and her make-out buddy, soaked from the knee down, holding their shoes, scamper i the hotel on the balls of their feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's eyes flutter awake to see Alex getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to fly stand-by and make a meeting in Milwaukee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notices, teasing) Oh, no. I made you feel cheap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, all right... Just leave the money on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll text you later so we can swap schedules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex gives him a peck. Ryan takes her wrist so she can't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember the last time I enjoyed spending time with someone as much as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss again and he lets go. Alex leaves and the door closes. Ryan just lays in bed for a moment. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie have a quiet breakfast. Natalie looks pr worse for wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background is a TRAVELING SALESMAN rolling calls. perks up for each message then goes back to being miserab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, after a little silent eating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night got a little out of hand. I said things... I don't remember everything I said. I just didn't want you to think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. It was nice to see you cut loose. So, did you wake him up or slip out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning... Your new friend. Did you wake him for an awkward good bye or just slip out so he could feel like a whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... just left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protocol is always tricky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know what was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes there really is no right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walkway overlooks a large MARINA filled with giant YACHTS. Ryan and Natalie are doing the photo thing with t CUT OUT of the engagement portrait again. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Alex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to skip town early to make a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. Where does she live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chicago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thinking of going to see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. We just don't have that kind of relationship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of relationship do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's, you know. Casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds pretty special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It works for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think there's any future there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought about it. What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really never thought about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a good lie) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you not think about these things? How does it not even cross your mind that you might want to have a future with somebody? 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's simple, you know that moment when you look into someone's eyes and you feel them looking right into your soul, and the whole world goes quiet for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally, a break through) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie knocks over the CUT OUT and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, I'm just dicking around. I need your help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it's worth giving her a chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chance to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chance at something real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, your definition of "real" is going to evolve as you get older...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stop condescending for one second? Or is that one of the principles of your bullshit philosophy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit philosophy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The isolation? The traveling? Is that supposed to be charming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's simply a life choice. 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cocoon of self-banishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Big words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, screw you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've set up a way of life that basically makes it impossible for you to make any human connections. Now, somehow, this woman runs the gauntlet of your ridiculous "life choice" and comes out the other end with a smile - Just so you can call her casual. Jesus. I need to grow up? You're a twelve year old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie begins walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a gauntlet of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUST OF WIND suddenly blows the CUTOUT across the board into the OCEAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan goes running after the cutout. He climbs down a GANG to a dock that is closest to the CUTOUT, which is beginni to sink in the filthy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan reaches... and reaches... and just as he's got a fin tip on the photo... FALLS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, still damp from the ocean, is drying the CUTOUT wit hair dryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're following the CUTOUT HEADS popping out of the ROLL- like earlier, only now they are slightly faded and bent f their trip in the harbor. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching Ryan through the window of the plane. He almost looks trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane lands amidst snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie drive in silence. The weather is frigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These Detroit guys can be tough. They've been getting hammered. Don't get distracted. Stick to the simple stuff. Get the packet in their hands and get them out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A one story brick building. There's an inch of snow on th ground. Ryan and Natalie enter the building in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie check in at the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. Ryan and Natalie enter, when they both se something and immediately stop short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting on the conference table is a COMPUTER set up for VIDEO CONFERENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Framed up in a WINDOW on the screen is CRAIG GREGORY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Detroit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie and Ryan exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here? 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been getting those great numbers over the last few days. Thought we should nut up and give this a try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could use a little more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta leave the nest at some point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a real company, Craig. We're here to do some damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Good thing we brought our best. So let's stop screwing around, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me a minute to prepare and get my things together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking Natalie takes this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, once confident, now takes pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's hardly ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been watching her. She's great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the webcam) This is a whole other animal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, she created it. Natalie, you not up for it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atta girl. 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie have a moment aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, don't apologize. Don't tell them how hard this is for you. Today is one of the worst days they will ever have. What we feel doesn't even compare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep it professional. You're going to do fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig is leaning back in his office chair, watching Natal on his monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unsuspecting man in his mid fifties enters the room an takes a seat at a COMPUTER TERMINAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (for the remainder of the scene, we will intercut between Natalie's room and the POV of the man's iChat session.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Samuels. My name is Natalie Keener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking out the PC) What's going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was here with better news, however your position here at Deckers is no longer available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been let go. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, just like that? I can't believe... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Miss Keener. I am here to tell you about your options...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work here for seventeen years and they send some fourth grader in here to can me? What the fuck is this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan fights the urge to jump in. He is sitting next to Natalie, but just out of view of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfectly normal to be upset. However, the sooner you can tell yourself that there are greater opportunities waiting for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greater opportunities? I'm fifty- seven-fucking years old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Samuels is now on the verge of tears. Eyes red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody who ever built an empire, or changed the world, sat where you are now. And it's because they sat there that they were able to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We remain in the room with Natalie and Ryan, but we hear Samuels crying. It's loud and embarrassing. It's coming f the next room. He's literally on the other side of the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a packet in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuels picks up the packet and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to take some time and review it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuels begins to leaf through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the answers you're looking for are inside those pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sooner you trust the process, the sooner your next step in life will unveil itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuels puts down the packet. The tears still coming slow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to return to your office now and begin to put together your personal things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samuels doesn't move. He's just sitting there in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time, Mr. Samuels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reaction. Just more silent tears. Natalie is getting n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Samuels? There's nothing else we can discuss now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan fights the urge to break in as Natalie continues to her composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig leans into his computer, watching intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Samuels... Mr. Samuels.... MR. SAMUELS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Samuels breaks from his daze. He looks up and ar for a second, then gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie catches her breath. A second later, Samuels passe their room, visible through the conference room windows. watch as he walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Want me to take over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie pulls out a LIST OF FORTY NAMES. The amount of pe is daunting. She crosses off the first name. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find Natalie standing next to the rental car. She's st into a snow drift. Her eyes say everything - She just gre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Ryan is on his CELL. We catch the end of his conversation with Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... We just got out here. That was one place. I think we need to try a few more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there isn't a difference, but it's comforting to know we're in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't give a shit about my comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could just use a little more time. That's all I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... Right. (shakes his head) Yeah... Alright... Uh huh. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thought you did a great job. You did - I was real proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being pulled off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of mixed emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is holding the LARGE EMBOSSED ENVELOPE of his sister WEDDING INVITATION. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out the RESPONSE CARD, looks at the line for ext guests, then sets it down. He pulls out the actual INVITATION. It looks inexpensive. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Natalie ride the MOVING WALKWAY. Something is on Natalie's mind. She speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about what I said about Alex. I was out of line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, who am I to be dolling out relationship advice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Omaha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better than you'd think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get off the moving walkway and stop at a GATE that r "Omaha". Something off screen grabs Ryan's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan begins to walk off. Pulls out his BLACKBERRY and dia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing another flight... Something I need to take care of. I'll see you in, uh... at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan disappears in the crowd. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're looking at the LUXOR PYRAMID.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Okay, start walking it in from the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX enters frame, carrying the engagement CUT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to admit, when you asked me to meet you in Vegas... I thought we'd gamble, make out in a heart shaped jacuzzi, maybe see one of those weird French Canadian circus shows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be plenty of time for all that. (directing the photo) One more foot to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex obliges. She checks out the engagement photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, I guess. (directing the photo) Okay great... walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex picks up the engagement photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a cute couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they'll make cute kids. If they're lucky, maybe look a little like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Ryan look at the photo together for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like Wisconsin in February?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who doesn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it if you're there. Besides, I know a killer burger in Milwaukee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Northern Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This quickly registers... He's inviting me to the wedding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I haven't even...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to be your date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To a wedding... Jesus, Ryan. Your sister's wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not like I know her that well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just not sure if it's appropriate for me to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. You know. I'm not the wedding type. But for the first time in my life... I don't want to be that guy, alone with his drink. I want a dancing partner. I want a plus one. And if you can stomach it, I'd like it to be you. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long thoughtful beat. Alex sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't believe I... Yeah, I'm in. When is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like we should kiss or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two ROLL-AWAYS side-by-side, moving through the terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex walk in unison. They share a smile. Almost they can't believe they're getting away with something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a LARGE AIRLINE ADVERTISEMENT featuring MAYNARD FINCH in uniform. "We Value Your Loyalty."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's rental car pulls into the CHALET SUITES driveway. halfway between a Swiss Lodge and a Best Western. Just a little sadder. A yellow sign reads "Welcome Miller-Bingha Wedding Guests!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex approach the check-in lines. Of course, the an elite membership line, but they can't use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is forced to stand in a queue of three people while CHECK-IN LADY just stands at her computer at the elite li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the CHECK-IN LADY) Are you available? 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, this line is for members of our Matterhorn program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan steams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex walk down the long hallway. They've been gi a room at the end. Just as they're entering their room, t door across the hall opens revealing a woman in her early forties with a basket of laundry. It's Ryan's sister KARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan turns and stops. It's been a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug. It's a strange hug. Awkward but heartfelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, this is my sister Kara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quite frankly...) Ryan has told me nothing about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara, what are you doing at a hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, I was hoping I wouldn't have to... Yeah, uh, Frank and I are trying out a trial separation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not staying at the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was an extra room on hold here, so I just took it for the weekend. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. So, you guys are dating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex fumble over each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not exactly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't worry about it. We're all getting a little old to be calling someone girlfriend... I remember when mom used to call Jack her boyfriend. It drove me up the wall. Boyfriends are for kids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm just a divorcee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat in the corridor of the Chalet Suites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, the rehearsal dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll see you two there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara humps the laundry basket down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex settle in. There's a cheap basket with a pi ribbon tied sloppily around some cellophane. In the baske a packet, outlining the wedding weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in life is worth doing that doesn't have a packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I love you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is kidding, but not really. They play it off as a jo but can't help feel the weight of this "moment". 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of tables have been slid together for the rehears dinner. Ryan and Alex find the dinner in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's sister JULIE, the bride, waves wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Ryan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hops up and gives him a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Alex. You are so beautiful. Kara was right. Did you get the basket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basket was very lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy wrapped all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tammy waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, you look so grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? You're the one getting married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, right? You haven't even seen my ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie shows off her ring. It's not quite balanced and see to favor quantity over quality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim designed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM raises a hand. This is Julie's husband-to-be and we c tell immediately that Ryan isn't thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan thinks of something. He pulls out the 5X7 PHOTOS the took of the JIM & JULIE CUT OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought those photos you were asking for... 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great! They go over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie points to a table and Ryan walks over. When he gets we see almost a hundred photos pinned to a map of America overwhelming. All of a sudden, his effort seems miniscule

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan begins to pin his photos on the map over the cities where they were taken. He backs away to see it as a whole his addition has already become invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan returns to the conversation with his sister and Alex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were quite a few already up there. Almost couldn't find room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, isn't it great how everyone chipped in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What gave you the idea to do something so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Substantial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Jim has a lot of our nest egg invested in this real estate venture right now. So when we went over our finances, a honeymoon just didn't seem affordable this second... So I thought... Hey, just because we can't travel doesn't mean we can't have pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idea of this lands on Ryan pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a great idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is stuck with Jim, talking real estate. Alex is havi chat with the brides maids about local relationship drama

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sixty acres up against the foothills. I subdivided the old Lazy W Ranch and took a nice slice for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim makes an exhale noise that means "you bet your ass".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homes will go in the high fours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a nice development.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a community, not a development. The concept is turn-key everything. You buy a maintenance contract with the home. We'll whack your weeds, we'll even change the light bulb. Furniture? You buy your own or choose a package. Seamless traditionalism, yet all the perks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex make eye contact. There's a joy in their connection amongst the ramblings of their company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all need a place to call our own. This is America. This is what we were promised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bit at the end about promise... I like it. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little embarrassed) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you still renting that one- bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're looking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation stalls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is leaving. Tammy grabs Julie's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe it's tomorrow?! How are you going to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some Xanax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's for sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm good. I'll have some warm milk. That should do the trick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim comes walking by with a box of flower arrangements fr the tables inside that are going to be reused at the wedd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more box... 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex steps back in and for the first time in who knows ho many years, Ryan, Kara, and Julie are alone together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim seems like a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know... Isn't he great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to make a great husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a moment where they just look at each other and giggle a little. Just the three of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Julie, I was thinking... with dad not being... Well, I didn't know if you had someone to walk you down the aisle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, Jim's uncle is going to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been really supportive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Oh, great. Just wanted to make sure you were covered. So I should get there at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests are arriving around 5ish. Things get going at 530. So you know, around then. It's easy. Just come down the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex comes out with the second box. Ryan notices and grab flowers from her and sets them in Jim's luxury pick-up tr 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, Alex, and Kara arrive at their adjacent rooms. Key cards slide in simultaneously. Alex heads in. Ryan stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Kara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you believe she's getting married already? She's just a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Ryan. Actually, she's 37 years old. She's barely squeaking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup. Sleep tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rental car pulls up into the empty lot. Snow on the ground. It's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex walk up the steps and try the door of the m building - it's locked. Ryan shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex starts walking down the side of the building, lookin for an open window. The third one opens a crack. She slid her HOTEL HONORS CARD in and opens the latch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we really doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a boost. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex slowly wedges herself headfirst through the window. climbs in after her. He immediately recognizes his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took geography in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was my seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever fool around with one of your teachers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until college. Come on, show me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A finger reaches and points to a teenage face.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex are huddled at the trophy case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You played basketball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point guard. Don't act so surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were such a jock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex walk passed a concrete ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first fight. 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got my ass kicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan shows an area behind the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where we used to go to make out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very romantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex and Ryan sit tight like teenagers on the team bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really happy I came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school soccer team takes the field for practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the team) Go Cougars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Players look back at him strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks caller ID) It's Kara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing we hear is crying in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara is on her cell phone. Behind her in the deep backgro we see bridesmaids consoling Julie. 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan, where are you? We're having a meltdown here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jim. Can you get back here? We need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan's rental car pulls up in front. He hops out and Alex takes the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll grab your suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan immediately spots Julie sobbing and being consoled b her bride's maids. The groomsmen are huddled in another corner, embarrassed and confused. Kara splits from the br maids and takes Ryan aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim's got cold feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how cold feet work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to talk to him? 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's either you or me. You know my record. I've already struck out once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been to bat. I haven't been in the dugout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you talk for a living? Motivational type stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell people how to avoid commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of fucked up message is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it might have helped you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat of stalemate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ryan. You haven't been around much. Fuck, you basically don't exist to us. I know you want to be there for her... Well here it is. This is your chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan quietly steps in to find Jim, half dressed in a tux reading the children's book "The Velveteen Rabbit". Jim sniffles. Ryan goes to leave, when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Jim. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever read this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's pretty powerful stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara mentioned you were having some... thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim puts down the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. What makes you say that today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just laying there last night in bed and I couldn't sleep. I was thinking about the wedding and the ceremony and all. Us buying a house and moving in together. Having a kid... Having another kid... (begins to snowball) ... Thanksgiving, Christmas, spring break, football games, all of a sudden they're out of school, getting jobs, getting married, And then, you know... I'm a grandparent. I'm retired. Before you know it - I'm dead... and I just kept thinking... "What's the point?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan gulps. Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now asking Ryan directly) I mean what is the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, what am I starting here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's marriage... it's the most beautiful thing on Earth... you know, what everyone aspires to... 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never got married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never even tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's hard to define "try".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem happier than most of my married friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, I'm not going to lie. Marriage can be a pain in the ass. And you're kind of right - All of this is just stuff on the way to your eventual demise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are all on running clocks that cannot be slowed down or paused and they all lead to the same place. Some guys leave marks that last beyond their own mortality. Not guys like you and me... But some. But even those footprints disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a "point".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim sinks a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the guy you'd normally want to talk to about all this stuff... But think about it - your favorite memories. The greatest moments of your life? Were you alone? 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks about it) No... I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to sound like a Hallmark card, but... Life? It's better with company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to think of it... Last night, the night before your wedding, when all this shit was circling through your head... Weren't you two sleeping in separate rooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Julie went back to the apartment and I was all alone in that big honeymoon suite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim chuckles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of lonely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Everybody needs a copilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This resonates with Jim and he can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nice touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the mood like out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good... Emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (twinkle in his eye) Go get her. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks over to the huddle of bride's maids. They part let him in. He kneels at Julie's feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm such a fuck up... Will you be my co-pilot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie gives him a perplexed look before smiling and falli into his arms. Tears and smiles spread amongst the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara walks over to Ryan and pats him on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan and Alex getting dressed in a little kitchen in th church. They're in a hurry and a little sloppy, but there crooked joy in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Jim standing at the alter with the priest getting a pat the back from his best man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Julie getting walked to the alter by Jim's uncle. They Ryan, who looks on proudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The priest gives his blessings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Jim raises Julie's veil. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Wedding attendees file into the Chalet Suites Banquet H

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan and Alex mingle with their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm your cousin... Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan and Alex dance like teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - The band does a cheesy choreographed dance step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Jim makes a speech. He is not good at public speaking, the guests are generous with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Tammy has her tongue down a groomsmen's throat. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan pulls Kara onto the dance floor. She rests her hea his shoulder and they slow dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Jim and Julie make their farewell and run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan and Alex help pick the center pieces off the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Ryan and Alex get into the elevator together. She's wea his jacket. We're about to see them kiss, when the elevat door closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Alex stand between their gates. One sign reads OMAHA. The other sign reads CHICAGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When am I going to see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to come and visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So settled down. You're not going to change on me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same guy. Just one address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a boarding announcement for Chicago. Alex begins step away to her gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me if you get lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm lonely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex turns for her gate and joins the crowd. Ryan goes to something. He has an impulse... but he finally ignores it gets in line under the sign that reads "OMAHA".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Ryan wheels in his Roll-Away. He walks to the window, parts the blinds and checks out his awful 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ryan opening some mail. We see Ryan laying in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet. It's alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie is giving Ryan a tour of the new ONLINE FIRING AR A series of cubicles with YOUNG GUYS ON HEADSETS. She is her element and very proud of her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Some guy sits down in a conference room somewhere and a server routes their session to one of our termination engineers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't actually call them that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer "terminators", but it bumped with legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I can't imagine why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow a workflow that can take them through anything from a standard dismissal to a violent aggressor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they actually on line, right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're beta-testing. Role-playing. We go live at the end of the month. (catches one of the guys making a mistake) Kyle, you're running through the events too quickly. You have to give them time to acknowledge each statement. Okay? It's a legal thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan can only watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is sitting at his desk. He puts on a HEADSET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig is leading a meeting. Ryan seems focused on somethi on his laptop. We see his screen: An itinerary for GoalQu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the GIANT DIGITAL MARQUEES reads: "GOALQUEST XX"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sits on a sofa, holding his BACKPACK. A slick GOALQU HOST enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to rock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan nods and gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stands in the wings. He takes a breath, then steps o in front of a sea of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GOALQUEST XX stage is like nothing we've seen yet. La and professional. Blue Banners hang from the ceiling. Dig projectors show Ryan's Headshot - What's In Your Backpack

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sets the BACK PACK on a table and quickly unzips it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last year, I flew three hundred fifty thousand miles. The moon is only two fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Uncomfortable. Ryan looks at the back pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine for a second that you're carrying a backpack... I want you to feel the straps on your shoulders... You feel them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan isn't feeling them. He is not inspired. He isn't believable. He's barely even there. 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I want you to pack it with all the stuff you have in your life. Start with the little things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is trying, but he can't find the will to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The... um... The stuff in drawers and on shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes a beat. He just stares at the backpack and thi about all the things he has removed from it... And then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Ryan leaves the stage. Handlers try to fig out what Ryan is doing. The Host runs for the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone just relax. We'll have your next guest out in a sec.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan hustles past SLOT MACHINES until he is actually jogg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan runs up to a gate. He's the last one to board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over Ryan's shoulder, through the window, we see Chicago below as the flight begins its descent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan on the PEOPLE MOVER under the ceiling of NEON LIGHTS Peaceful music emits from hidden speakers. Ryan walks bri past idle riders. 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan hurriedly signs a hand-held device, hops into a SEDA and speeds off. The RENTAL CAR ASSISTANT suddenly realize

dialogues.speaker: RENTAL CAR ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Hey, you forgot to give me your Devotion Club card!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan steps out of his rental car and approaches the door the townhouse - checking the address against a piece of HILTON STATIONARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stops, knocks, and puts on a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Footsteps. The door unlocks and opens revealing A She's wearing sweatpants and glasses. She's at home. She looks different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's something else. Alex is in shock... She's fro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong. Ryan's smile begins to melt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's voice calls from inside.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (O.C.)
dialogues.text: Honey, who's at the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple kids run by through the background, giggling. A chases after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex is still speechless. Her eyes are angry and apologiz all at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan just stands there. Emotionally bleeding to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan begins to step away. He turns and heads for his car, dropping the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex's husband becomes visible just as she's shutting the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that? 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just some guy who was lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan gets in his rental car and drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're watching Ryan through his window from far away... a as if looking through binoculars. He sits on his bed, tie undone, holding a glass with an inch of scotch on his kne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see quick glimpses of Ryan getting ready. Crappy littl COFFEE MAKER crappily brewing. Crappy hotel BAR OF SOAP crappily lathering. Crappy HAIR DRYER crappily blowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is on the phone with Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you lie to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex sits in the car with the engine running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking - Just showing up at my door like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? I wanted to see you. I didn't know you had a family - Why didn't you tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I thought we signed up for the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to help me understand. What is it you signed up for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought our relationship was perfectly clear. You're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long beat) ... an escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a break from our normal lives... A parenthesis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a parenthesis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, Ryan? I can't believe we're having this conversation. I mean what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stumbles on this. What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know what you want. I'm sorry that I ruined your night... But you could have seriously screwed things up for me. That was my family. That's my real life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was a part of your real life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Ryan. I'm a grown up. I don't hold a grudge. When you're ready to be an adult and see me again, just give me a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan can't quite believe what he's hearing. There's only thing he can do. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan is walking when his phone buzzes. He checks the DISP CTC Calling. He presses IGNORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan walks up to the TICKET DESK. He is more lost than us There is something plucky about the TICKET AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: PLUCKY TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Mr. Bingham. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right, you got me in 2C?

dialogues.speaker: PLUCKY TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: Of course. Left side aisle, non- bulkhead. Just like you like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's got you so fucking happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plucky agent fades a bit, then tries to recompose.

dialogues.speaker: PLUCKY TICKET AGENT
dialogues.text: Your boarding card, Mr. Bingham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes the ticket and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sits doing nothing. Others around him play Sudoku, r trashy paperbacks, work on laptops. Ryan just stairs at t stitching on the seat in front of him. When... "Bing"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we have a special announcement to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our pilot has just informed me that we are passing over the city of Mesa... which might not mean much to most of you, but means a lot to one of our fliers today, because he just hit TEN... MILLION... MILES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gershwin theme song for the airline rains down from t overhead speakers. Passengers clap. Flight attendants gat at Ryan's seat with big smiles and champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan doesn't even react. He's just stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flight attendants separate just enough for a man in a bomber jacket to squeeze through. It's Maynard Finch, the Chief Pilot from the commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seat taken? 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard gives a little salute to his flight attendants, t slides by Ryan to the window seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the youngest yet to hit twenty mil. Don't know where you found the time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right, here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maynard pulls out a MEMBERSHIP CARD. It's actually been stamped from platinum.

dialogues.speaker: MAYNARD FINCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seventh card we've made. Small club. We really appreciate your loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has a pair of wings around "Member Number 7". Ryan hol it between his fingertips... Catches his own reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how many times I've thought about this moment? Played out the conversation I'd have with you right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? What did you want to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I... I can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright. Happens to all of us. (attempts chit chat) So, where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan looks at him straight in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan picks up the phone at his desk. He removes his new T MILLION MILE CARD and dials a number off the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Bingham. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how did you know it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your dedicated line. We reserve them for our most loyal and dedicated fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'd like to transfer some of my miles. Can you open up an account under Jim and Julie Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Certainly. How many miles would you like to transfer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many miles would it take to circle the globe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have our "around-the-world" tickets. They're five hundred thousand miles each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig enters Ryan's doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the airline operator) I'm going to have to call you right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Craig takes a seat across from Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you yesterday? I was trying to reach you all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got tied up in... personal stuff. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An uncomfortable beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember Karen Barnes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan doesn't. 109.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG GREGORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She was part of a thirty person reduction a few weeks back in Wichita. Natalie fired her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I fire dozens of people a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself. Jumped off a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember anyone giving you any signals of anything? Depression?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all depressed. We're firing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, you know I have to ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't remember anything. Of course they're upset. You never think that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't any woman who gave you any indication...? Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan remembers her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing that stands out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Natalie alright? Is she coming in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan isn't surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Text message. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stifles a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG GREGORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, real fucking nice, right? No one has manners anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She say where she was going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. She was pretty upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should give her a call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you back in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan doesn't react.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG GREGORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you hear me? I thought you'd be thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. What about video conferencing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CTC is pausing on the whole new media front for a moment. Giving it a little more thought. Getting our work horses back out doing what they do best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are you sending me out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to let you sail and sail. Send us a postcard if you ever get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan absorbs this. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MANAGEMENT LEVEL GUY sits at his desk. Bay Area sports paraphernalia on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We turn to reveal Natalie. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How exactly do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You graduated top of your class. You seemed to have your pick of employment... Including right here. Instead, you went to Omaha... to fire people for a living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's challenging work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't imagine doing that day-in- day-out. Not in this climate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) ... I followed a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager smiles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody does at one point or another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager raises a letter - It's Ryan's letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy says I'd be lucky to have you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan writing the letter. We hear what he's writing...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: To whom it may concern, I can't even count the number of people I've fired in my lifetime. So many, that I've forgotten what it's like to actually hire somebody. We've never met, but I know you'd be lucky to have Natalie Keener. My advice? Take her and don't look back. She'll be the best decision you've made in a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The manager puts down the letter and reaches out a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie breaks into a smile, then jumps back to professio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan steps out his front door, ROLL-AWAY in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan walks through the automated door. He looks like he d in the opening of the film. Maybe even wearing the same clothes. Something is different though.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tonight, most people will be welcomed home by jumping dogs and squealing kids. Their spouses will ask about their day and tonight they'll sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan stops and looks up at a GIANT BOARD OF DESTINATIONS. endless list of cities around the world. A menu of new li departing every five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The stars will wheel forth from their daytime hiding places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look back at Ryan. His eyes lock on one of the cities. don't see which one. He makes a mental decision and turns the direction of the gate. He lets go of his ROLL-AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And one of those lights, slightly brighter than the rest, will be my wingtip, passing over, blessing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan takes a step, but before his foot can land we...
